poem:
Last Night of the Proms

Crowds waver in symphonic silence,
air thick with restless breath,
between notes that span eons,
and fiddles drenched in time.

A Mexican wave rises,
half cheer, half rebellion,
as the baton searches for its place,
a small victory for warmth
over the long,
artificial,
pause.
